snippet: The city’s recommendation to keep residents at nursing and adult homes in flood-prone areas during Hurricane Sandy had dire consequences.
abstract: Recommendation that thousands of elderly, disabled and mentally ill residents remain in more than 40 nursing homes and adult homes in flood-prone areas of New York City during Hurricane Sandy had calamitous consequences; at least 29 facilities in Queens and Brooklyn were severely flooded and buildings were plunged into darkness, with no access to power, water, heat and food; no immediate deaths were reported, but it took at least three days for crews from around the country to rescue over 4,000 nursing home and 1,500 adult home residents.

byline.original: By JENNIFER PRESTON, SHERI FINK and MICHAEL POWELL

lead_paragraph: The city’s recommendation to keep residents at nursing and adult homes in flood-prone areas during Hurricane Sandy had dire consequences.
